title.narrative: INCLUSION AND QUALITY IN EDUCATION

description.narrative: By September 2015, national and local authorities, including ethnic authorities, and civil society organizations have strengthened their capacity to develop and implement comprehensive strategies that promote quality and inclusiveness of education for the most vulnerable populations (with emphasis on indigenous and Afro-Colombian populations)., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, children, adolescents and women in situation of inequality and exclusion, have access to social services of higher quality.

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, national and local authorities, including ethnic authorities, and civil society organizations have strengthenedtheir capacity to develop and implement comprehensive strategies that promote quality and inclusiveness of education for the mostvulnerable populations (with emphasis on indigenous and Afro-Colombian populations).
Number of territorial entities that incorporate strategies to counter exclusion in schools in the sectorial education plans.

Number of territorial entities that implement the Comprehensive Adolescent Development Strategy (that generate knowledge and experiences to influence local policies to the benefit of the comprehensive development of adolescents).

baseline.value: In January 2012, 1 territorial entity implements the Comprehensive Adolescent Development Strategy

title.narrative: Number of territorial authorities that implement assistance plans for institutional improvement with a rights-based approach

baseline.value: In January 2012, 3 territorial authority entities implement assistance plans for institutional improvement with a rights-based approach

title.narrative: Number of educational institutions which implement strategies to strengthen the transition from secondary to technical education and from the latter to higher education.

baseline.value: In January 2012, 400 educational institutions implement strategies to strengthen the transition from secondary to technical education and from the latter to higher education.

title.narrative: Number of educational institutions that have developed Community Education Projects redesigned according to the cultural parameters of their community, targeted to Afro-Colombian and indigenous communities

baseline.value: In January 2012, 5 educational institutions have developed Community Education Projects redesigned according to the cultural parameters of their community, targeted to Afro-Colombian and indigenous communities.

title.narrative: Number of educational institutions that develop and implement Improvement Plans regarding the quality of education with a rights-based approach

baseline.value: In January 2012, 73 educational institutions develop and implement the Improvement Plan regarding the quality of education with a rights-based approach

title.narrative: Number of projects implemented with the participation of children and adolescents with HIV in the four areas of development defined by the HIV alliance.

baseline.value: The alliance has been meeting up starting four years ago with the participation of seven cities, 120 children and adolescents and through training modalities and virtual participation: Red Escale la Vida and Aleja la Ignorancia.
